        I believe it's because WGC is used as a fallback due to some bugs that we'd seen primarily on Windows 11. This option configures it; <span class="line"><!---->I believe it's because WGC is used as a fallback due to some bugs that we'd seen primarily on Windows 11. This option configures it; <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/desktop_capture_options.h;drc=7216b27406d094834d8644a525370069a70d2f93;l=182<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/desktop_capture_options.h;drc=7216b27406d094834d8644a525370069a70d2f93;l=182"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/desktop_capture_options.h;drc=7216b27406d094834d8644a525370069a70d2f93;l=182<!----></a><br>And this restricts it to Windows 11: <span class="line"><!---->And this restricts it to Windows 11: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/window_capturer_win.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=30<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/window_capturer_win.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=30"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/window_capturer_win.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=30<!----></a><br><br>The patch was initially added due to some cross-process capture issues; primarily youtube: <span class="line"><!---->The patch was initially added due to some cross-process capture issues; primarily youtube: <!----></span>https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/252625<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/252625"><!---->https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/252625<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> and then restricted to Win 11 due to an (unrelated) crash: <span class="line"><!----> and then restricted to Win 11 due to an (unrelated) crash: <!----></span>https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/258821<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/258821"><!---->https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/258821<!----></a><br><br>To be sure I understand, it seems like the issue is that the underlying window is destroyed, but we may still try to capture it because we haven't received the ItemClosed notification yet? Or the item may not exist when we attempt to unsubscribe?<span class="line"><!---->To be sure I understand, it seems like the issue is that the underlying window is destroyed, but we may still try to capture it because we haven't received the ItemClosed notification yet? Or the item may not exist when we attempt to unsubscribe?<!----></span><br>RE:<span class="line"><!---->RE:<!----></span><br>>  `OnItemClosed` eventually be called in `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread` <span class="line"><!---->&gt;  `OnItemClosed` eventually be called in `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread` <!----></span><br>I don't believe I'm seeing this method/call?<span class="line"><!---->I don't believe I'm seeing this method/call?<!----></span><br><br>IMO, the bug that this originally patched seems fairly minor, so we may want to try forcibly disabling this behavior (which should be a fairly scoped fix, though unfortunately one that does not have a flag associated with it at present). I do not however have access to a windows 11 machine to ensure there are no other side-effects from disabling it.<span class="line"><!---->IMO, the bug that this originally patched seems fairly minor, so we may want to try forcibly disabling this behavior (which should be a fairly scoped fix, though unfortunately one that does not have a flag associated with it at present).           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1413005#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 7, 2023, 3:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        The issue is `OnItemClosed` will be called on `WgcCaptureSession` that is already destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->The issue is `OnItemClosed` will be called on `WgcCaptureSession` that is already destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>It can happen if the window is closed just when we try to capture it. For example if you set a bp in `hr = capture_session->StartCapture(options_);` in `WgcCapturerWin::CaptureFrame()`, and then close the captured window, then the call will fail and `ongoing_captures_.erase(capture_source_->GetSourceId());` will be called, which will destroy `WgcCaptureSession`. <span class="line"><!---->It can happen if the window is closed just when we try to capture it. For example if you set a bp in `hr = capture_session-&gt;StartCapture(options_);` in `WgcCapturerWin::CaptureFrame()`, and then close the captured window, then the call will fail and `ongoing_captures_.erase(capture_source_-&gt;GetSourceId());` will be called, which will destroy `WgcCaptureSession`. <!----></span><br>During the destruction of `WgcCaptureSession`, the COM thread can still send the message that signals the window is closed. If it succeeded to send it before we reach `item_->remove_Closed` in `RemoveEventHandlers`, then `OnItemClosed` will be called on the freed object.<span class="line"><!---->During the destruction of `WgcCaptureSession`, the COM thread can still send the message that signals the window is closed. If it succeeded to send it before we reach `item_-&gt;remove_Closed` in `RemoveEventHandlers`, then `OnItemClosed` will be called on the freed object.<!----></span><br><br>The easiest way to see it is to comment out the `item_->remove_Closed` line and close the captured window in the bp as I described. It will trigger the crash.<span class="line"><!---->The easiest way to see it is to comment out the `item_-&gt;remove_Closed` line and close the captured window in the bp as I described. It will trigger the crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        OnItemClosed just sets a bunch of variables to nullptr: <span class="line"><!---->OnItemClosed just sets a bunch of variables to nullptr: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/win/wgc_capture_session.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=394<a class="undefined" target="_blank" `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread`<!----></span><br><br>I don't think it would be possible for us to call double close, and it looks like we aren't actually calling a method on the capturer.<span         It looks like the root cause might be deleting Item object inside ItemObject's Closed Event handler. it could leads to unexpected behavior like the above crash or different crash. <span class="line"><!---->It looks like the root cause might be deleting Item object inside ItemObject's Closed Event handler. it could leads to unexpected behavior like the above crash or different crash. <!----></span><br><br>WgcCaptureSession::OnItemClosed() {<span class="line"><!---->WgcCaptureSession::OnItemClosed() {<!----></span><br>item_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->item_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>When using only WGC by changing the code in DesktopCapturer::CreateRawWindowCapturer, the crash keeps happening whenever any window is closed because the Item object is destroyed; The caller of the OnItemClosed back to Item object where it was destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->When using only WGC by changing the code in DesktopCapturer::CreateRawWindowCapturer, the crash keeps happening whenever any window is closed because the Item object is destroyed; The caller of the OnItemClosed back to Item object where it was destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>The potential fix is to move "item_ = nullptr" to the WgcCaptureSession dtor.  (btw, WgcCaptureSession will be destroyed only when Picker window is closed.)<span class="line"><!---->The potential fix is to move "item_ = nullptr" to the WgcCaptureSession dtor.  (btw, WgcCaptureSession will be destroyed only when Picker window is closed.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This can be<span class="line"><!---->underlying WGC object inside it's own event handler. This can be<!----></span><br>problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<span class="line"><!---->problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<!----></span><br>we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<span class="line"><!---->we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<!----></span><br>reject.<span class="line"><!---->reject.<!----></span><br><br>This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<span class="line"><!---->This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<!----></span><br>handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<span class="line"><!---->handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<!----></span><br>attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<span class="line"><!---->attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1413005<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1413005" title="Security: A UAF in         1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<span class="line"><!---->1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<!----></span><br>The CL from <span class="line"><!---->The CL from <!----></span>comment #24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c24"><!---->comment #24<!----></a><br><br>2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<span class="line"><!---->2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<!----></span><br>The CL in question does not appear to have made it to Canary yet, due to needing to be rolled into Chromium from WebRTC. Note that I also do not have a Windows 11 PC, so am unable to test the scenario described without local modifications.<span class="line"><!---->The CL in question does not appear to have made it to Canary yet, due to needing to be rolled into Chromium from WebRTC. Note that I also do not have a Windows 11 PC, so am unable to test the scenario described without local modifications.<!----></span><br><br>3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<!----></span><br>The fix should be safe, it defers destruction of a handful of objects until the destructor runs instead of when receiving an event. Events are unsubscribed and any usages of these object are either creations or have a corresponding check with the "is_item_closed_" bool that blocks their further usage. The expected next call into the class to generate a frame (which should come fairly rapidly) should trigger the object to be destroyed. Though I have not tracked the exact path, the repro scenario described above (e.g. with the picker open), may not query for a new frame, but does query the OS<span class="line"><!---->The fix should be safe, it defers destruction of a handful of objects until the destructor runs instead of when receiving an event. Events are unsubscribed and any usages of these object are either creations or have a corresponding check with the "is_item_closed_" bool that blocks their further usage. The expected next call into the class to generate a frame (which should come fairly rapidly) should trigger the object to be destroyed. Though I have not tracked the exact path, the repro scenario described above (e.g. with the picker open), may not query for a new frame, but does query the OS<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br>I do not believe so<span class="line"><!---->I do not believe so<!----></span><br><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<!----></span><br>I don't think manual verification is required; but it may be beneficial to test the repro described.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think manual verification is required; but it may be beneficial to test the repro described.<!----></span><br><br>I will also note FWIW, that I did not get the exact stack mentioned in the bug or crash reports here; but one that combined with the fix leaves me reasonably confident that it should address the issue. I could also only repro the POC on my Windows 10 machine when running under a debugger, but that may be the result of not having an ASAN build that got lucky and just worked, or because this is partially a timing issue.<span class="line"><!---->I will also note FWIW, that I did not get the exact stack mentioned in the bug or crash reports here; but one that combined with the fix leaves me reasonably confident that it should address the issue. I could also only repro the POC on my Windows 10 machine when running under a debugger, but that may be the result of not having an ASAN build that got lucky and just worked, or because this is partially a timing issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This can be<span class="line"><!---->underlying WGC object inside it's own event handler. This can be<!----></span><br>problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<span class="line"><!---->problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<!----></span><br>we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<span class="line"><!---->we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<!----></span><br>reject.<span class="line"><!---->reject.<!----></span><br><br>This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<span class="line"><!---->This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<!----></span><br>handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<span class="line"><!---->handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<!----></span><br>attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<span class="line"><!---->attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1<a This can be<span class="line"><!---->underlying WGC object inside it's own event handler. This can be<!----></span><br>problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<span class="line"><!---->problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<!----></span><br>we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<span class="line"><!---->we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<!----></span><br>reject.<span class="line"><!---->reject.<!----></span><br><br>This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<span class="line"><!---->This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<!----></span><br>handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<span class="line"><!---->handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<!----></span><br>attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<span class="line"><!---->attempt to restart the capturer, and         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
<a class="__crdxFeedbackButton" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback"></a></body>


      
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1413005: Security: A UAF in WebRTC
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1413005: Security: A UAF in WebRTC
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The bug is triggered in `third_party\webrtc\modules\desktop_capture\win\wgc_capture_session.cc` in the `OnItemClosed` method causing the browser process to crash.<span class="line"><!---->The bug is triggered in `third_party\webrtc\modules\desktop_capture\win\wgc_capture_session.cc` in the `OnItemClosed` method causing the browser process to crash.<!----></span><br><br>This method is being called from a message pumping thread (`DesktopMediaListCaptureThread`) as you can see the crash dump, and in case a video session is shutting down because the captured window is closed, there is a race between the COM thread and our thread that can lead to `OnItemClosed` being called on a freed `WgcCaptureSession`.<span class="line"><!---->This method is being called from a message pumping thread (`DesktopMediaListCaptureThread`) as you can see the crash dump, and in case a video session is shutting down because the captured window is closed, there is a race between the COM thread and our thread that can lead to `OnItemClosed` being called on a freed `WgcCaptureSession`.<!----></span><br><br>The problem starts in  `CreateDispatcherQueueController` function that is being called on `third_party\webrtc\modules\desktop_capture\win\wgc_capturer_win.cc`.<span class="line"><!---->The problem starts in  `CreateDispatcherQueueController` function that is being called on `third_party\webrtc\modules\desktop_capture\win\wgc_capturer_win.cc`.<!----></span><br>According to the MSDN, it creates a background COM thread that send messages to our message pumping thread. When a window is closed, it can be that `WgcCaptureSession` get destroyed (because of `ongoing_captures_.erase(capture_source_->GetSourceId());` when `GetFrame` from this window fails, or if the video session is closed by the user) while the COM thread tries to send a message (before `item_->remove_Closed` is called in `RemoveEventHandlers`) that will make `OnItemClosed` eventually be called in `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread` on freed `WgcCaptureSession`.<span class="line"><!---->According to the MSDN, it creates a background COM thread that send messages to our message pumping thread. When a window is closed, it can be that `WgcCaptureSession` get destroyed (because of `ongoing_captures_.erase(capture_source_-&gt;GetSourceId());` when `GetFrame` from this window fails, or if the video session is closed by the user) while the COM thread tries to send a message (before `item_-&gt;remove_Closed` is called in `RemoveEventHandlers`) that will make `OnItemClosed` eventually be called in `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread` on freed `WgcCaptureSession`.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version:  109.0.5414.120 (stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:  109.0.5414.120 (stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>We need to close a native window while it is being captured with `WgcCapturerWin` to trigger the race.<span class="line"><!---->We need to close a native window while it is being captured with `WgcCapturerWin` to trigger the race.<!----></span><br>There are 2 classes that webrtc uses to capture video in Windows:<span class="line"><!---->There are 2 classes that webrtc uses to capture video in Windows:<!----></span><br>`WindowCapturerWinGdi` (primary) and `WgcCapturerWin` (secondary). It always start with `WindowCapturerWinGdi`, and only if it fails it falls back to `WgcCapturerWin`. It is decided in `FallbackDesktopCapturerWrapper::CaptureFrame`.<span class="line"><!---->`WindowCapturerWinGdi` (primary) and `WgcCapturerWin` (secondary). It always start with `WindowCapturerWinGdi`, and only if it fails it falls back to `WgcCapturerWin`. It is decided in `FallbackDesktopCapturerWrapper::CaptureFrame`.<!----></span><br><br>So our target is to make `WindowCapturerWinGdi` fail. But it is fairly easy task. In `WindowCapturerWinGdi::CaptureFrame` there is a check `IsWindow(window_)`<span class="line"><!---->So our target is to make `WindowCapturerWinGdi` fail. But it is fairly easy task. In `WindowCapturerWinGdi::CaptureFrame` there is a check `IsWindow(window_)`<!----></span><br>to see if the windows is still valid before capturing the frame, and if it returns false, we fallback eventually to capture using `WgcCapturerWin`. It means that if we close the captured window before this check, all the next video captures will use `WgcCapturerWin`. We can actually visually see when this transfer between the capturing methods, because when `WgcCapturerWin` is in use, every window has a yellow frame. You can see it in the poc video.<span class="line"><!---->to see if the windows is still valid before capturing the frame, and if it returns false, we fallback eventually to capture using `WgcCapturerWin`. It means that if we close the captured window before this check, all the next video captures will use `WgcCapturerWin`. We can actually visually see when this transfer between the capturing methods, because when `WgcCapturerWin` is in use, every window has a yellow frame. You can see it in the poc video.<!----></span><br>Now, we need to close any captured native window and the race occurs.<span class="line"><!---->Now, we need to close any captured native window and the race occurs.<!----></span><br><br>The way I reproduce the whole thing is with the screenshare window picker. No permission is needed from the user to show the window picker.<span class="line"><!---->The way I reproduce the whole thing is with the screenshare window picker. No permission is needed from the user to show the window picker.<!----></span><br>The picker is good spot because it captures a video for each window in the system to show it in the thumbnails.<span class="line"><!---->The picker is good spot because it captures a video for each window in the system to show it in the thumbnails.<!----></span><br><br>The POC is done with python on Windows 11 VM (with 8GB ram + 4 cpus). To run it just open 'poc.html' and run 'python poc.py' (notice that the bug is statistic, so maybe you need to increase the number of notepads to see a crash). The poc steps include:<span class="line"><!---->The POC is done with python on Windows 11 VM (with 8GB ram + 4 cpus). To run it just open 'poc.html' and run 'python poc.py' (notice that the bug is statistic, so maybe you need to increase the number of notepads to see a crash). The poc steps include:<!----></span><br> - Create some notepad processes.<span class="line"><!----> - Create some notepad processes.<!----></span><br> - Open the window picker for screensharing.<span class="line"><!----> - Open the window picker for screensharing.<!----></span><br> - Close the notepads in random timing, which cause at one point to move from <span class="line"><!----> - Close the notepads in random timing, which cause at one point to move from <!----></span><br>   `WindowCapturerWinGdi` to `WgcCapturerWin`. It Can be visually confirmed by <span class="line"><!---->   `WindowCapturerWinGdi` to `WgcCapturerWin`. It Can be visually confirmed by <!----></span><br>   the windows yellow border.<span class="line"><!---->   the windows yellow border.<!----></span><br> - Create some more notepads.<span class="line"><!----> - Create some more notepads.<!----></span><br> - Close them all at once and hope for the crash when `OnItemClosed` is called.<span class="line"><!----> - Close them all at once and hope for the crash when `OnItemClosed` is called.<!----></span><br><br>Some notes:<span class="line"><!---->Some notes:<!----></span><br> - I noticed weird behavior on my physical computer while reproducing this bug on <span class="line"><!----> - I noticed weird behavior on my physical computer while reproducing this bug on <!----></span><br>   it. For example, sometimes the yellow border stayed around some windows after <span class="line"><!---->   it. For example, sometimes the yellow border stayed around some windows after <!----></span><br>   chrome was terminated, or that the Screen Snipping tool (winkey+shift+s) <span class="line"><!---->   chrome was terminated, or that the Screen Snipping tool (winkey+shift+s) <!----></span><br>   stopped working because it was crashing every time I tried to use it <span class="line"><!---->   stopped working because it was crashing every time I tried to use it <!----></span><br>   afterwards. I attach a dump of that process crash too.<span class="line"><!---->   afterwards. I attach a dump of that process crash too.<!----></span><br> - I got another crash that doesn't show `OnItemClosed` in the stacktrace one <span class="line"><!----> - I got another crash that doesn't show `OnItemClosed` in the stacktrace one <!----></span><br>   time. Not sure what happened there but it also looks like UAF on <span class="line"><!---->   time. Not sure what happened there but it also looks like UAF on <!----></span><br>   `WgcCaptureSession`.<span class="line"><!---->   `WgcCaptureSession`.<!----></span><br> - If an attacker can create native windows from JS somehow, it can be pretty <span class="line"><!----> - If an attacker can create native windows from JS somehow, it can be pretty <!----></span><br>   straightforward to cause the crash. For example, using ctrl+shift+p show the <span class="line"><!---->   straightforward to cause the crash. For example, using ctrl+shift+p show the <!----></span><br>   native printing window which can also be captured and trigger this bug <span class="line"><!---->   native printing window which can also be captured and trigger this bug <!----></span><br>   (although it's not possible to show it from js without `--disable-print- <span class="line"><!---->   (although it's not possible to show it from js without `--disable-print- <!----></span><br>    preview` AFAIK).<span class="line"><!---->    preview` AFAIK).<!----></span><br><br>Suggested solution:<span class="line"><!---->Suggested solution:<!----></span><br>- To not use `OnItemClosed` at all and to check `IsWindow()` or any other way to <span class="line"><!---->- To not use `OnItemClosed` at all and to check `IsWindow()` or any other way to <!----></span><br>  verify the capture window is still valid before capturing a frame.<span class="line"><!---->  verify the capture window is still valid before capturing a frame.<!----></span><br>- Need to check if `OnFrameArrived` can suffer from the same race problem.<span class="line"><!---->- Need to check if `OnFrameArrived` can suffer from the same race problem.<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>CONTEXT:         I attached a new demo video. At 0:30 you can see where we move from `WindowCapturerWinGdi` to `WgcCapturerWin` (all the windows get yellow border).The crash is in 1:42 (it also causes the whole screen to become black for a sec).<span class="line"><!---->I attached a new demo video. At 0:30 you can see where we move from `WindowCapturerWinGdi` to `WgcCapturerWin` (all the windows get yellow border).The crash is in 1:42 (it also causes the whole screen to become black for a sec).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 7, 2023, 1:37 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1413005#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 7, 2023, 1:37 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I believe it's because WGC is used as a fallback due to some bugs that we'd seen primarily on Windows 11. This option configures it; <span class="line"><!---->I believe it's because WGC is used as a fallback due to some bugs that we'd seen primarily on Windows 11. This option configures it; <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/desktop_capture_options.h;drc=7216b27406d094834d8644a525370069a70d2f93;l=182<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/desktop_capture_options.h;drc=7216b27406d094834d8644a525370069a70d2f93;l=182"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/desktop_capture_options.h;drc=7216b27406d094834d8644a525370069a70d2f93;l=182<!----></a><br>And this restricts it to Windows 11: <span class="line"><!---->And this restricts it to Windows 11: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/window_capturer_win.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=30<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/window_capturer_win.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=30"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/webrtc/modules/desktop_capture/window_capturer_win.cc;drc=0c4306fc554c80506eb0f9b833a5d2a5fdd452d5;l=30<!----></a><br><br>The patch was initially added due to some cross-process capture issues; primarily youtube: <span class="line"><!---->The patch was initially added due to some cross-process capture issues; primarily youtube: <!----></span>https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/252625<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/252625"><!---->https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/252625<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> and then restricted to Win 11 due to an (unrelated) crash: <span class="line"><!----> and then restricted to Win 11 due to an (unrelated) crash: <!----></span>https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/258821<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/258821"><!---->https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/258821<!----></a><br><br>To be sure I understand, it seems like the issue is that the underlying window is destroyed, but we may still try to capture it because we haven't received the ItemClosed notification yet? Or the item may not exist when we attempt to unsubscribe?<span class="line"><!---->To be sure I understand, it seems like the issue is that the underlying window is destroyed, but we may still try to capture it because we haven't received the ItemClosed notification yet? Or the item may not exist when we attempt to unsubscribe?<!----></span><br>RE:<span class="line"><!---->RE:<!----></span><br>>  `OnItemClosed` eventually be called in `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread` <span class="line"><!---->&gt;  `OnItemClosed` eventually be called in `DesktopMediaListCaptureThread` <!----></span><br>I don't believe I'm seeing this method/call?<span class="line"><!---->I don't believe I'm seeing this method/call?<!----></span><br><br>IMO, the bug that this originally patched seems fairly minor, so we may want to try forcibly disabling this behavior (which should be a fairly scoped fix, though unfortunately one that does not have a flag associated with it at present). I do not however have access to a windows 11 machine to ensure there are no other side-effects from disabling it.<span class="line"><!---->IMO, the bug that this originally patched seems fairly minor, so we may want to try forcibly disabling this behavior (which should be a fairly scoped fix, though unfortunately one that does not have a flag associated with it at present). I do not however have access to a windows 11 machine to ensure there are no other side-effects from disabling it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 7, 2023, 3:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1413005#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 7, 2023, 3:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The issue is `OnItemClosed` will be called on `WgcCaptureSession` that is already destroyed. <span class="line"><!---->The issue is `OnItemClosed` will be called on `WgcCaptureSession` that is already destroyed. <!----></span><br><br>It can happen if the window is closed just when we try to capture it. For example if you set a bp in `hr = capture_session->StartCapture(options_);` in `WgcCapturerWin::CaptureFrame()`, and then close the captured window, then the call will fail and `ongoing_captures_.erase(capture_source_->GetSourceId());` will be called, which will destroy `WgcCaptureSession`. <span class="line"><!---->It can happen if the window is closed just when we try to capture it. For example if you set a bp in `hr = capture_session-&gt;StartCapture(options_);` in `WgcCapturerWin::CaptureFrame()`, and then close the captured window, then the call will fail and `ongoing_captures_.erase(capture_source_-&gt;GetSourceId());` will be called, which will destroy `WgcCaptureSession`. <!----></span><br>During the destruction of `WgcCaptureSession`, the COM thread can still send the message that signals the window is closed. If it succeeded to send it before we reach `item_->remove_Closed` in `RemoveEventHandlers`, then `OnItemClosed` will be called on the freed object.<span class="line"><!---->During the destruction of `WgcCaptureSession`, the COM thread can still send the message that signals the window is closed. If it succeeded to send it before we reach `item_-&gt;remove_Closed` in `RemoveEventHandlers`, then `OnItemClosed` will be called on the freed object.<!----></span><br><br>The easiest way to see it is to comment out the `item_->remove_Closed` line and close the captured window in the bp as I described. It will trigger the crash.<span class="line"><!---->The easiest way to see it is to comment out the `item_-&gt;remove_Closed` line and close the captured window in the bp as I described. It will trigger the crash.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It looks like the root cause might be deleting Item object inside ItemObject's Closed Event handler. it could leads to unexpected behavior like the above crash or different crash. <span class="line"><!---->It looks like the root cause might be deleting Item object inside ItemObject's Closed Event handler. it could leads to unexpected behavior like the above crash or different crash. <!----></span><br><br>WgcCaptureSession::OnItemClosed() {<span class="line"><!---->WgcCaptureSession::OnItemClosed() {<!----></span><br>item_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->item_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br><br>When using only WGC by changing the code in DesktopCapturer::CreateRawWindowCapturer, the crash keeps happening whenever any window is closed because the Item object is destroyed; The caller of the OnItemClosed back to Item object where it was destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->When using only WGC by changing the code in DesktopCapturer::CreateRawWindowCapturer, the crash keeps happening whenever any window is closed because the Item object is destroyed; The caller of the OnItemClosed back to Item object where it was destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>The potential fix is to move "item_ = nullptr" to the WgcCaptureSession dtor.  (btw, WgcCaptureSession will be destroyed only when Picker window is closed.)<span class="line"><!---->The potential fix is to move "item_ = nullptr" to the WgcCaptureSession dtor.  (btw, WgcCaptureSession will be destroyed only when Picker window is closed.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://webrtc.googlesource.com/src/+/318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://webrtc.googlesource.com/src/+/318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1"><!---->https://webrtc.googlesource.com/src/+/318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1"><!---->318cf28945d80a0ac6f09382e507c95e649cc4c1<!----></a><br>Author: Alexander Cooper <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Alexander Cooper &lt;<!----></span>alcooper@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alcooper@chromium.org"><!---->alcooper@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Feb 08 22:16:01 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Feb 08 22:16:01 2023<!----></span><br><br>Fix Destruction inside WGC Callback<span class="line"><!---->Fix Destruction inside WGC Callback<!----></span><br><br>If we are notified of the destruction of the window before a<span class="line"><!---->If we are notified of the destruction of the window before a<!----></span><br>CaptureFrame call can fail, then we may end up attempting to destroy the<span class="line"><!---->CaptureFrame call can fail, then we may end up attempting to destroy the<!----></span><br>underlying WGC object inside it's own event handler. This can be<span class="line"><!---->underlying WGC object inside it's own event handler. This can be<!----></span><br>problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<span class="line"><!---->problematic, as the class itself may want to run other code. Instead,<!----></span><br>we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<span class="line"><!---->we just unsubscribe and signal that any future CaptureFrame calls should<!----></span><br>reject.<span class="line"><!---->reject.<!----></span><br><br>This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<span class="line"><!---->This also removes setting "is_capture_started_=false" in the item closed<!----></span><br>handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<span class="line"><!---->handler, as all that served to do is cause the WgcCapturerWin code to<!----></span><br>attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<span class="line"><!---->attempt to restart the capturer, and somewhat muddies up our metrics.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1413005<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1413005" title="Security: A UAF in         1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<span class="line"><!---->1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<!----></span><br>The CL from <span class="line"><!---->The CL from <!----></span>comment #24<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c24"><!---->comment #24<!----></a><br><br>2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<span class="line"><!---->2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<!----></span><br>The CL in question does not appear to have made it to Canary yet, due to needing to be rolled into Chromium from WebRTC. Note that I also do not have a Windows 11 PC, so am unable to test the scenario described without local modifications.<span class="line"><!---->The CL in question does not appear to have made it to Canary yet, due to needing to be rolled into Chromium from WebRTC. Note that I also do not have a Windows 11 PC, so am unable to test the scenario described without local modifications.<!----></span><br><br>3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<!----></span><br>The fix should be safe, it defers destruction of a handful of objects until the destructor runs instead of when receiving an event. Events are unsubscribed and any usages of these object are either creations or have a corresponding check with the "is_item_closed_" bool that blocks their further usage. The expected next call into the class to generate a frame (which should come fairly rapidly) should trigger the object to be destroyed. Though I have not tracked the exact path, the repro scenario described above (e.g. with the picker open), may not query for a new frame, but does query the OS<span class="line"><!---->The fix should be safe, it defers destruction of a handful of objects until the destructor runs instead of when receiving an event. Events are unsubscribed and any usages of these object are either creations or have a corresponding check with the "is_item_closed_" bool that blocks their further usage. The expected next call into the class to generate a frame (which should come fairly rapidly) should trigger the object to be destroyed. Though I have not tracked the exact path, the repro scenario described above (e.g. with the picker open), may not query for a new frame, but does query the OS<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br>I do not believe so<span class="line"><!---->I do not believe so<!----></span><br><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<!----></span><br>I don't think manual verification is required; but it may be beneficial to test the repro described.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think manual verification is required; but it may be beneficial to test the repro described.<!----></span><br><br>I will also note FWIW, that I did not get the exact stack mentioned in the bug or crash reports here; but one that combined with the fix leaves me reasonably confident that it should address the issue. I could also only repro the POC on my Windows 10 machine when running under a debugger, but that may be the result of not having an ASAN build that got lucky and just worked, or because this is partially a timing issue.<span class="line"><!---->I will also note FWIW, that I did not get the exact stack mentioned in the bug or crash reports here; but one that combined with the fix leaves me reasonably confident that it should address the issue. I could also only repro the POC on my Windows 10 machine when running under a debugger, but that may be the result of not having an ASAN build that got lucky and just worked, or because this is partially a timing issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);

    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;

    display: block;

  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
